reviews.review_msg: easy if u just read her notes

She is so sweet! I loved being about to take a class with her. My class was online so it wasn't required to attend lectures, although she did include some test material based on what was only talked about in the lecture (if the time doesn't work for you, she does record them). Understand the content, as exams are difficult and hard to study for.
Don't take this course with this professor if you want to boost your GPA

Lectures were long but he's super engaging. Quizzes were pretty nasty, but tests were WAY worse, like they really did batter me. Online quizzes were decent but super specific. He does a great job of explaining thing, is very passionate about ling, and goes over quizzes/tests well. Overall decent class, just pls pls pls be prepared for testing.

Took this class as it sounded very interesting. Was excited to learn, but by exam week I was regretting taking this course. Slides were very informative, tests looked like they were from a 400 level course. Don't take this class if you're looking for an elective. If you arent in Linguistics (I am a bus student) then stay away.

Was not looking forward to this class since it was 3 hours but he has made things so interesting right from the beginning! Lectures are super clear and slides are easy to understand. Quizzes are reasonable, tests are a bit tough but nothing out of the ordinary. His review assignments and slides are great. Overall, will do his best to help you pass

THE most boring class I've ever taken, mostly because of the prof but the lecture was 3 hours long on Monday... The actual material was interesting, but I would suggest looking it up on your own time rather than wasting money. The worst part was the final exam, which tested your ability to work out word problems over your knowledge of the material.

He is a horrible lecturer! blabbers on and on about nothing in class pretending to make jokes and then makes the MT's super hard and about nothing that you learnt or was in the book. come on! this is a 100 level course. he needs to stop thinking its the most important thing in the world.
neat and useful slides.

Like other said, you do want to attend the lectures because he prepares really well and he is humurous! But exams are really demanding! Don't ever take it as an elective, cause you have to study it as a core course! Generally a really nice guy.

Awesome prof! I took Linguistics as an elective out of curiosity and I totally do not regret it! Interesting lectures and lots of practice before exams. If you do your readings on time definitely an easy A!
Strongly NoT RECOMMEND to people take this courses as elective!! Midterm and final Exam are freaking hard !! He puted this 100 level course to 400 level!
very entertaining lectures but extremely difficult exams!2 midterms M/C and final M/C and definitions and short essay.not gpa booster for sure!
Like his lecture,but very difficult midterms and he said the final won't be easy.Not doing curve.

Lectures are engaging and attentive. However, that's where his advantages end. His Exams are formed in a way that is extremely roundabout and ambiguous, have too many questions that are too specific and obscure, and he doesn't even talk about them in class at all! I don't recommend him as a GPA booster, I'm saying this after receiving an A-

Great prof. He knows his stuff and teaches with a passion. I came into the course with 0 interest but he made it fun every day. Very clear, helpful, and funny. VERY easy Midterm and Final.  GPA booster right here.

Horribly hard. The 100 level course felt like a 400 level due to his inability to adjust it to a younger generation (minus points for that. Also, 3 exams and not one paper??? How do you expect anyone to get higher than a C+??!!

He posts all of the notes online each week, and I honestly don`t find the point in going to class because all he does is go over his notes. You don`t even really need the textbook because his notes are very clear and concise. People complain that his midterms are hard, but I didn`t find them hard - they were fair, people just need to study better.

Burgess is an outstanding instructor. Two major components stand out. First, he has a background as an ESL instructor, which shines through in the clarity of his instruction. Second, he was once a lawyer, and his professionalism and high levels of organization are unlike anything I've encountered. If you take school seriously, take him.

Lectures can be quite boring.  He sends you notes every week so all you have to do is sit there in class and make sure that you understand what he is talking about.  If you can get someone from the previous semester to send you the questions from previous exams, that is the best, because they are pretty much all the same.  Just memorize everything.
It was a fair course, and I found it pretty interesting. He is a fun prof!
hes super hard to follow during classes...ive even tried to listen to his recorded lectures and i totally fall asleep. he's hard to follow
pretends to be nice, extremely hard exams, he makes this course incredibly hard!!! lots of terminology to memorize, linguistics is not as easy as you think, just avoid this guy!
GOOD Prof...but it seems he taught too much. he conducts the class not like a 100 level course...students must think and think, then do better on his exam...the final is really hard though
lame jokes.even lamer exams
He might be clear in his teaching and can communicate well but the exam is tough though and also he is not really friendly.
Great Prof, kept the class interesting. He's really good at explaining the material and does a lot of review so you know what's likely to end up on the exam. He made the class really enjoyable.
No Comments

he's too stubborn to teach, always thinks he's right, and unwilling to discuss matters. on the second midterm he had a VERY ambiguous question.  he was unwilling to listen to my concerns and i ended up getting in a big argument with him in his office.

Not a terrible class.  Scaled the marks, which is good.  He REALLY needs to drop the jokes though; I don't care what the person below said, but you don't have to be "smart" to get them - it's just that they're excruciatingly cheesy and pointless.

Exams were tough, but I still think the guy is an awesome prof and great person. I love his evil little jokes! Those that say he's not funny just aren't smart enough to get the jokes. He's really nice,got a great sense of humor, good teaching ability, and is now one of my favorite profs.
Not the best prof in the world.  Tough marking and dry material.

The guy himself - not bad.
 The guy as a prof - horrible.  If you are used to getting A's in courses that force you to actually think, don't bother with this mediocre elective.
I agree.  Horrible Tests.  NOT FUNNY.  Terrible and dry class overall.

Cute and shiny head.  ;).  Meh.  Really boring and bland.  Readings are useless and tests don't actually quiz you on what you know (and this is coming from someone who's getting a mark in the 90s right now).  Readings are unnecessary.  He's a good guy, but I would take a stats course over this one.
Good Teaching style, clear, makes the course interesting to listen to. Most of the stuff on the tests are on the notes, but the tests are hard. The readings are unnecessary and very boring (dry).
He is a really interesting prof. His tests are not way to specific. The readings are kind of dry, but you can get away without reading them and still do well.

Nice Prof. funny guy...the midterms are fair, Textbooks are useless in this class= =!His notes are good enough to get a B+ on the tests, as long as you memorize thoes stuff on the notes..anyway, He's not bad!!
Professor B. really helps you out if you show some initiative. And vervets really are important!
Rude and easily annoyed. class sucks and is boring as HELL. my pillow needed a pillow
He is very dynamic, class is always interesting

Well, seeing as this is a requirement for me, he's making the course BEARABLE.  He's funny at times and really not at others.  His tests are ruthless and complete "fluff": rather than testing our knowledge, he tests us on little irrelevant details.

Fantastic prof! Goes out of his way to help keen students, is very motivated & really loves what he teaches. Great course! I got an A on my first midterm, but I studied hard. Midterms straight out of the notes. He's funny & engaging & makes lectures interesting. Notes available on net before class!
Very Articulated, tests are STRAIGHT out from notes.. Dont even bother with the readings
hard tests, funny class though.
no curbed marks. hard tests. fun class. If you dont care about marks take this class. If you do dont
He is an interesting prodfessor, but be aware of the exams. Interesting lecture doesn't mean you have easy papers!!
don't waste $ on the required text books. he's usually pretty clear when going over his notes in class.

Very good use of media in his course. Usage of website, tape recordings, and such are very helpful for 1st-year students. Enjoyable and interesting material. I personally am delighted with his effort to make light of his course.
provides detailed (but poorly formatted) notes, cracks lame jokes that aren't funny or endearing, easy exams provided you study his notes, but don't waste your time and money on the "required" texts
he is the worst prof that I ever ever have in my university life!!! Yah, you can *only* study notes for his midterms, but what's the point we buy the textbooks? Trying to sucking our money or what?

I'm surprised at the number of people in other courses who say he's hard.  His lectures are..kinda interesting, tries to be funny, and his exams are pretty easy.  Just follow his notes and go to lectures.
NO Comment, Absolutely NO Comment!!!!!
very enjoyable course if taken with this guy...but relatively much memory work invovled...

The professor does not repsond to emails and the averages of every single assignment are beyond horrendous. This class is meant to be an introductory course, but the material is way above introductory and no one in the class knew what was happening. I received highest marks in the examinations, but the assignments are graded horribly. DONT TAKE!!
Supposed to be an easy class but is very difficult. Do not take with this teacher is you want a high grade. Class is made out of in-class assignments and quizzes that are confusing.

WORST prof I hv ever had, she makes u read the chapter and expects us to know the WHOLE BOOK for the quiz. The quizzes points out the smallest details from the book & everybody would get the question wrong & she still doesn't see us struggling. Doesn't make sense whatsoever, gives the worst lecture & keeps giving us readings on top of readings.

Claudia Wong is not a good professor. She does not do a good job of going through the material that was outlined in the syllabus. She did give us a textbook, but it does not go over any concepts. from the textbook. The assignments were impossible because there was no explanation of the material or concepts in the lecture slides or the textbook.
Don't take her class if you want to get a higher mark.

He just repeated his lectures notes in class, so no need to attend the lectures. Tests are heavy, but seem to be based on lecture notes only, so no need for textbook. Memorize everything in the notes and you can ace the exams.

The two midterms were very difficult compared to other 100-courses, but the final turned out to be pretty easy. Therefore, even though I suffered during the course, the result is not too bad. In sum, it is average :)

Dr. Das is a nice guy, however his exams are very challenging. The material is very dry and his lectures are too long. He does not provide enough examples in class. There are no participation marks or papers for this course and therefore if you do badly on your midterms (average was a C) then there is no way to boost your mark. Not a gpa booster.

After taking this course, I've lost all interest in linguistics. He's a nice guy, occasionally funny, but his three hour lectures are so dull. I thought the exams would be easy since it's all multiple choice but he chooses some really obscure and tricky questions, so you can't rely on just grasping the general ideas.

You can tell the professor loves linguistic but he can't explain some concepts well, especially to a student like me that is not a linguistic major. If you have to take this course, make sure to read the textbook. Thankfully the lecture is mostly based on the text, and you'll pass the course as long as you read it and memorize it!

u cant believe an exactly 100 class is hard like this, as a starting course in university. It's heavy on both memorization and thinking, which means you need memorize tons of stuff and apply them quickly -- 50 questions per 75 mins for midterms, 80 questions in two hours for final. AND the professor has a ridiculous accent, can I say dirty words???

i'm a 300 level student, i passed all the courses before, and my gpa was 2.9 UNTIL I TOOK THIS GUY'S LING100. I never seen a 100 level can contain so many materials, 2 difficult midterms worth 60%, and our class average was C!!!! It means half of my classmates got a grade below C ....

Unfortunately this is a very difficult class! He himself is a decent professor, but there is an obscene amount of material for a first year course, it's not that I wouldn't recommend him... I just wouldn't recommend the course! I am an A student and am receiving a C+. If you do take it, make sure to put LOTS of time aside to study for the exams.

100% of your grade is based on your midterms and final but felt very unprepared for the midterm. Felt like there were a lot of trick questions that were very misleading in what was actually being asked. Very clear that many of my classmates were not too impressed with the test format and the grading. I won't be taking his classes again.
class is really hard and not worth the stress. exams are worth so much but the professor doesn't properly prepare you for them
Amazing Prof!

Would 100% take another course taught by Trevor. He genuinely cares about how students are doing and adjusts his exams accordingly. What he expects/will test is very clearly communicated and he also understands the abysmal cost of textbooks so uses none in his teaching but instead provides easy to understand lecture slides.

I took Ling100 as an elective this summer and Trevor was so accommodating. I was struggling in another class of mine and after explaining that to Trevor he was more than happy to give me extensions for assignments so that I could work around my other classes exams. He was so accessible via zoom& email. Best prof at SFU hands down. he's a real gem!!

Trevor is by far is the best prof I have had at SFU. He really cares about his students and wants them to do well! For the quizzes and tests the answers were all in the lectures. He is super approachable and responds fast to emails. Weekly quizzes, 3 tests, and 3 homework assignments. I would 10/10 take another course taught by him.

Trevor is an incredibly caring professor who wants nothing but success for his students. Lectures are informative and easy to follow with interesting material. He is happy to receive input from his students and makes alterations to the course to best suit the needs of students. I haven't met a better professor than Trevor.

Looking for an easy, fun, and genuinely enjoyable class? This is definitely it. Prof Block deserves all the 5/5 ratings. Really understanding and down-to-earth guy. Always open to feedback for the course and takes his job seriously with a bit of fun. Gets along with all the students and I'm sure the staff loves him as well. BEST PROF EVER!

By far the best instructor I've had so far. Incredibly clear explanations, very fair tests and assignments, super accessible outside class. I wish I could give a 100/5 on rate my prof that's how legendary Trevor is. Ling 100 covers a variety of topics in linguistics and not all of them are interesting, but Trevor makes it all so fun and cool.

Weekly quizzes and 3 midterms. As others have mentioned, often the questions on the tests were incorrect, and she would fix them afterwards and give you credit, but it made the tests stressful. Lectures were fun & engaging, she is friendly & helpful. Answered all questions asked during lecture or on canvas. Had to study and read the book to do well
Her lectures were long but it wasn't the worst. She did have a problem with updating practice questions to the correct answer for some reason. Honestly just not the best or worst prof I've had.

Consistently remarks work because she doesn't know the correct answers for the tests SHE wrote. Tests are brutal and often make no sense, material lifted directly from the notes will be listed as an answer yet marked incorrect?? An infuriating environment that makes you want to retreat, not grow.

Weekly quizzes so class is essentially mandatory. 3 Midterms with no final, each with a group portion to boost your grade. Very kind and attentive professor that genuinely wants you to learn. Ask questions and she will help! Some of the questions on exams were unclear and were omitted. Quizzes were out of 10. Nicest teacher I've had at SFU!

I decided to take her LING100 class in Vancouver rather than in Burnaby (with a not-so-good prof), and I don't regret it at all! She does weekly tests and homework so I recommend paying attention. She drops the worst test mark though! Exams are quite hard but she always gives study outlines and no surprises. Easy A if you study hard & don't skip!
he is a nice guy.good pro.the midterm was way too easy, but the final exam was hard.I never went to the lecture, just read the book.textbook is extremely helpful.i like this course.

She is okay. First of all, don't bother buying the book like I did. Just study the lecture slides and you'll be set. She doesn't explain things very well, and spends a painful amount of time discussing trivial things that don't matter in the least. She seems like a good person though. Also, she can read and write Latin!

Well, other people may not like her but trust me she isn't that bad(she was my TA before!). If you read over the lecture slides(multiple times) you will get a high grade on the exams.  Don't read the textbook since its a waste of time. This is a mark booster if you are interested in Linguistics and are willing to understand the material she gives.

You may think this is a well rounded elective for a gpa booster...dont think this.. you never have to go to class (because their usually 20 mins anyways), and she reads right off the ppt..but her tests are horrible and manipulating!!! dont bother studying because youll get the same mark as if you didnt study..i would suggest another teacher

just went over her practice exams to be ready for final and had to put my fist in my mouth to prevent myself from yelling. She tricks you on almost every single question, is so unfair, and uses words to confuse you which in the end mean the same thing. this class tests how good u are at not stepping in the bear trap.. not how much u know or studied

I HATED this class. Im a hardworking (3.0gpa) student and studied hard for all her midterms but managed to get b:"&^%$ over by unfair questions that were so hard and extremely specific. She has a condescending and an arrogant attitude towards her students. She yelled at us (400pp people)right before us marking her for teacher evaluations...smart
This class may seem easy, but she finds a way to manipulate things and create a very difficult class

As a future LING major, I have an interest in the content of this course. This prof is amazingly clear and easy to understand, as are her slides. However, the midterm is very confusing with roundabout questions and unfair ones- such as something we covered 3 lectures after the midterm.
I was pretty excited looking at the syllabus for the class. However, I would have as much luck doing it distance ed. Because of her, I will never take another LING course.

Reads her slides that are posted online, thus making the lecture completely optional. Textbook and Custom Course-ware do not need to be read at all, as her tests are based 95% off of her slides. Seems knowledgeable about the subject, but has difficulty showing interest.

Clearly a new professor, struggles with keeping a consistent time frame. Hour and a half classes end up being 30 minutes and she goes through slides too quickly. Fairly rude in one-on-one meetings during office hours and doesn't care about individual students. Course is basically self-directed, fairly easy content but lecture is a waste of time.

• Took LING315 with Meg and I just love her, so I chose to take LING100. She really loves psycholinguistics—so anything to do with that is her bread and butter.
• Course was really easy since I had already taken many of the 300-level linguistics courses.
• Lots of homework & papers, beware!

Prof Grant is very approachable and does her best to make the material accessible. She also uses recorded lectures which is a plus but I personally found the material challenging and struggled to grasp some of the concepts. If you're new to linguistics, be prepared to put in extra effort, as the content can be difficult to understand at times.

I loved Dr. Grant's class; I found Ling 100 to be very interesting. Assignments were fairly easy and her exams were also fair and based mostly on her slides and some extra online external content posted online (since this class was blended offline/online). Her slides can be confusing but she does elaborate on her slides in lectures which helped me

The material she presents in lectures is hard to piece together since she makes them feel like different topics rather than ideas that intertwine. Lectures don't make any connections between topics and ideas, is not clear, and is not engaging. Only good thing is content is easy and you don't need to attend lectures at all.
She is a good professor with interesting lectures. The assignments reflect what u learn in the class and the midterm isn't too hard. good class

Very good prof. Clearly passionate in Linguistics. Lectures are very engaging and she gives good examples from the theory provided. The readings are mostly based on the lectures too, but it helps to just grasp information in two different formats.
watch out for this one
No Comments

Anne is one of the best at SFU.  She is well-organized, explains concepts very clearly, and her tests are always fair.  She makes long lectures engaging, and while she's not a stand-up comic like some profs, she has a good sense of humour.  100% would recommend taking LING 100 with her.
Organized and speaks intelligently. Powerpoint notes are helpful. Anne makes the 3 hour lectures interesting. Would recommend.
She is good

WORST PROF EVER!  she does not test on course material. Went into the midterm feeling very prepared, studied off of her study guide, and I barely managed to pass it. Definitely would not recommend this course with her.
Best professor ever! Her lectures are engaging, I never got bored, and if you need help she goes above and beyond to talk to you!
Great prof! She makes sure that you understand the course materials. No final, only 3 midterms (multiple choice)  and online participation. She also provides study guide for the exams.

Amazing teacher! Made a 3 hour lecture very entertaining (videos, discussions, etc...). Exams are very fair - if you understand and read the material you will do well.  Very helpful as well; she quickly responded to questions asked on Canvas.

I thought she was amazing! 3 hour long lectures, but broken up with 2 ten minute breaks, videos and group discussion in class. Textbook was interesting and engaging. Subject anyone can relate to, because we all use language. No final exam, 3 noncumulative midterms instead. Attendance not mandatory but you miss weekly quizzes if you skip class.

Highly recommend taking this class with Anne. Interesting, engaging, and very little commitment. Lecture are long but Anne recgonizes this and give you lots of breaks and really strives to brake up the class with discussions and video. Anne has inspire me to pursue a degree in linguistics and I'm so happy to have had her as a prof!!

I found Anne to be excellent at explaining the course content. There wasn't any material presented that didn't make any sense after the lecture. She really started at the begining. She also realizes that sitting through a 3 hour lecture is hard and so gives you lots of breaks.

Great Prof. She is very knowledgeable and is passionate about her subject. She made me want to study more linguistics, although it's fairly far outside of my major. Besides her excellent teaching abilities she is also a great person in private.

I think Anne was really nice and you can tell she is interested in linguistics. Overall, the course was fairly easy although I did not receive the grade I had hoped for. Midterms are pretty much based on lectures. I would say you could probably get away without reading the textbook.
Midterm1 was hard .Midterm2 and Final were pretty straightforward.  I do not like her grading system, so its better to avoid her. she was really helpful when I asked some question though..
the course is easy but the exam is HARD. exams are M/C but you have to read evey thing in the books(tow books) and lectures.. If you want to lose your GGPA then take a course with her :)

Very clear lecture, and she is a good teacher that she will listen to the students and try to make changes, she shows her respect! Not like other old and conceited pro., and exams contain only M/C questions which are very straight forward! Study through the exam study guide, you will get a good grade!

Very easy going prof. Course was all multiple choice. Prof is very organized and well spoken. She is genuinely interested in teaching linguistics and is happy when students get something out of her course.
If you study all the notes that she gives you then the test seems very straightforward. Lectures are valuable.
ridiculous prof.  really made a l00 level course so much harder. tested way too specific.
Arrogant person. Explain everything so unclear and confuse. Midterm is extremely specific. Make a easy GPA booster course much more difficult

Treats her class like children and her exams are ridiculously hard. Tolerates ZERO noise in the lecture. No sense of humor. If she sees you talking you will be called out. Everyone I talk to in this class hates it. I am interested in the material but how she teaches it is awful. She needs to lighten up and change her attitude toward students.

Treats class like grade 2 children behaviourally, words exams at way higher maturity level than 100 level course should be. She'll wait for everyone to completely cease talking before starting the lecture, and will stop to tell you off if she hears any chatting during.
Stupid prof, worst I see in sfu, must be first year teaching.

The way she teaches is so unclear, dull and boring. Very hard projects. Althoght she has some handy notes, but doesn't make the situation better. This is an absolutely easy course but she just makes it like a 300 level course! Unbelievable, never take her course or you will be regretted for sure, it drags your gpa down! Office hour is useless too!!

TBH I have nothing to say other than if you need an elective this is an easy class. yeah, it requires some effort but its easier than a lot of other classes I've been to and she really cares about your wellbeing and your grades. easy to approach and an easy marker.

I took this class because I wanted to take an elective and it seemed interesting. She is a great lecturer, the class is split between in person and online. Participation counts, 3 midterms and 2 assignments, the content in the midterms is what is talked about in the lectures so no surprises. Overall a good class!
the grading scale is soo difficult. assignments were easy. 3 midterms but was hard to get a good grade on them although they were based only on lecture material. dasha is super nice

Super enjoyable professor. Lectures and content were engaging. The assignments and midterms were very easy although the grading scheme was a little rough. 3 non cumulative midterms and 3 assignments. Participation marks are taken

Dasha made LING 100 an enjoyable course. It was interesting doing an asychronous course (participation both in lecture and online), but it was fun. Lectures were engaging and straightforward, and the material on tests were directly from her slides.

Dasha is easily one of my favourite profs at SFU. Her lectures are enjoyable, albeit some could be on the longer side. There's no surprises on the midterms, as all the content comes from her lecture slides. If you review the lectures before midterms, you'll be fine. Highly recommend taking LING 100 with Dasha!
Professor Gluhareva had been providing her students with an immense amount of knowledge about linguistics, which enabled me to become the linguistic expert within my communities!

I know Professor Gluhareva personally since I have been visiting her during her office hours, and she is friendly, supportive, and inspirational. She is my role model. One thing about her awesome class is: I likey, likey, likey!

Dasha is a very nice prof. She is very understanding and tries to make the lecture as engaging as possible. Her assignments were very easy to do. Her tests are based on the lecture, so if you study them you will do good, and her tests are fair.
Super fair workload, not overwhelming even for a first semester student. My favourite teacher yet with her engaging lectures and easy going personality.

HANDS DOWN ONE OF THE BEST PROFS!!! Even tho it was only my 1st sem, I have to say, she is an amazing prof (and person too). She was very engaging during lectures and never hesitated to answer any questions. I kid you not, she would always ask if anyone had anything to ask/say after every other slide. If ur into ling do anything to be in her class!

I LOVE Dasha! She is so passionate about her topics and is always willing to answer questions. She is super engaging and is just the most wonderful professor I've had so far. I cannot express how much I adore her!! I would have gotten an A, but I did not study for the first exam. Her exams are all memory based so they are straighforward!
She wants to see you succeed. Engaging lectures w/ plenty of opportunity for participation, criteria is clear for assignments and exams are on exactly what is covered in lectures.

Professor Gluhareva is an amazing professor, I would definitely take a course with her again! Go to lectures, this has most of the info needed for tests. Lectures are pretty engaging as she gives lots of examples, asks the class many engaging questions, and has in-class participation. The 3 tests are straightforward with MC+Fill in the blank+SA.
Took LING 100 with her in the Spring. Very easy course. Heather was very sweet and was a pretty good intro to linguistics. Overall great experience and a very nice professor

Prof Bliss is a kind and passionate prof! She really tries to make lectures interesting and engaging, and does a good job of incorporating popular culture and current slang. Her lecture notes are easy to follow and she encourages a lot of in-class participation and activities which is a nice way to connect to the material.

I think she's a great prof. She loves her line of work and shows it in her lectures. Exams and assignments based on lectures. Must understand topics well to get a better grade. A solid intro course if you do not know what to take. Been taking another course with her the consecutive sem. Clear grade criteria, interesting lectures, simple assignments
Exams are fair, material wasn't too hard. Good prof, passionate about her subject and willing to help students
Fair,clear,passionate about her field, available to students.

Although I didn't enjoy the class itself, I found Heather to be a really great prof. You can tell that she's really passionate about linguistics and really encourages the class to share their ideas, too. You can basically not show up to her class and just refer to the online slides she posts and you'll be good. Her tests are also really fair.

Favourite professor so far. No tutorials but she encourages participation and discussion during lecture. Genuinely nice person and tries to remember your name. She's clearly very passionate about linguistics and her exams are straightforward - she even states her exams are to support our learning. Really want to take another course with her :)
Took her in Albt.  Ok but not the best.  I couldn't understand her english.

She was my nightmare during the summer! Her strong accent made everything not understandable. Worst of all, she didn't respect her students at all. She made mistakes on grading my two midterms and refused to change when I talked to her in person, which made me very mad. DONT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY! There are tons of electives you can choose.

Horrible Horrible Prof.  When you ask for clarification on a certain concept through email, she does not bother responding at all.  She gives study guides for you to study and a final review, but the answers from both the study and review sometimes differ even if its the same question.  Accuracy is clearly not her strong point.
Really enjoyed listening to his lectures, very funny guy. This course may work for some, but not for ones who don't love super lecture heavy courses and a lot of memorization
Exams were hard!
In a summary, he is a good comedian, but NOT a good lecturer.

Yourie is one of the best professors I've had. He's such a funny guy and he is clearly very passionate about his work. In LING 100 he has 3 midterms  (NO "FINAL") which are fairly easy if you read over his lecture notes.

I gave him a pepper because he is HOT in the inside! Very nice Professor and his humor can help you get through the 3 hour lectures. Don't really need the textbook and you can just go to the important classes. He provides you with all the notes online that you need for the mid-term, so study off that and easy A for you. Requires good memorization.

Dr. Pankrats is the single most passionate prof I've ever seen- he truly loves what he does and that makes his lectures interesting. This class was easy! As long as you attend all lectures and take half-decent notes, plus read the book and the study material he provides before exams, you're guaranteed a decent mark.
I LOVE HIS COURSE AND MATERIALS. THE COURSE IS NOT HARD. BUT NEED TO WATCH THE TIME DURING THE MIDTERMS. PREPARE MIDTERMS FOR 3 TO 4 DAYS(IF 4 TO 5 HOURS A DAY). I LOVE THIS COURSE!
There is not much assignment. And if u know all the notes well, u r good to go!
Easy! Take it! Notes are important!
Great prof! Funny and entertaining while still being informative. He sends out really helpful study guides before exams.

The coolest prof ever! You need to attend class for notes. His notes are super clear and straight to the point. Study off his notes and you'll be fine. He makes class enjoyable and linguistics interesting. :)

Yourie is awesome! Love the whistling--you're my hero! Class was okay, can't say I attended every one but the ones I did attend was because of Yourie and not the content. Content was boring but he makes the class great and he's very helpful if you don't it. Exams were kinda long but easy format. Notes are generally more important than readings.

Good prof,very interesting and passionate. He is easy to understand, he gave you the samples of exams and questions before the exam which is helpful to you to understand your weak part of the study. In conclusion, he is very very good.
easy course, memorize his lecture notes and you'll do fine. no need to read texts
Good prof, this course was probably my most enjoyable course i had this year
easy course, lecture helpful, and he records lectures.
its an easy course and his lectures are helpful. he also recorded the lectures

He is an amazing teacher and his class was one of the most amazing moments of my life. He has a small accent which makes it easier to focus and makes me happy. Best teacher of my life, Im sad he deonst work there

Prof Elouazizi is fair and approachable.  His expectations are clear and notes are pretty straightforward.  He really wants his class to participate in discussions and really wants his students to do well. Course content is really interesting and online discussions are easy marks. Three midterms (30 mc) based on lecture slides
just read the lecture notes, midterm and final are pretty easy.

Although his accents is a bit "unique", he tries his best to engage the class through asking though-provoking questions and clarification. 3 MCQ exams were quite easy as long as you submit your discussion paragraph and study off the powerpoints well. Would take his classes again but maybe hold off on the books.

Noureddine was an okay prof. His lectures always seemed unclear and inconsistent with the notes. His exams were sorta difficult. Attendance was definitely unnecessary. Yet, his class was really BORING and he tells you the textbook is required but tbh none of the exams cover the textbook material, so DONT BUY THE TEXTBOOK!

Worst prof i have ever seen. Huge accents, confusing lecture notes, terrible lecture skills. Not even 60% attendence on his lecture, because it's pretty useless. The text book is very expensive, he tells you to buy it , but it's very unlikely you will need it for this course.Ling 100 is easy, but don't ever take his course :)
